pageContext.claim: “I told Japan -- so we lose $100 billion a year with Japan -- $100 billion.”
pageContext.analysis: President Trump exaggerates the U.S. trade deficit with Japan. In 2017, it was $69 billion when only looking at trade in goods; the overall deficit would be lower if trade in services is included. As we've explained before, a trade deficit simply means that people in one country are buying more goods from another country than people in the second country are buying from the first country. In this case, the U.S. has a trade deficit on goods and a trade surplus of services.
